Summary of Catplat CLI Sub-commands

Sub-command 1

Sub-command 2

Description

analyze

adsorbate

Analyze adsorbate structure.

analyze

bulk

Analyze bulk structure.

analyze

complex

Analyze complex structure.

analyze

miller

Analyze bulk structure to obtain facet-like miller indices.

analyze

sites

Analyze adsorption sites of a slab.

analyze

slab

Analyze slab structure.

build

adsorbate

Create/Write adsorbate structures.

build

bulk

Create/Write bulk structures.

build

complex

Create/Write complex structures.

build

multicomplex

Create/Write multi-adsorbate complex structures.

build

slab

Create/Write slab structures.

calculate

-

Run Catplat workflow calculations.

config

-

Set up new project/view current project settings.

database

backup

Backup database to file.

dryrun

-

Trial run for catplat claculate.

entry

delete

Delete selected entries.

entry

delete-key

Delete attribute keys.

entry

ignore

Ignore selected entries.

entry

update-key

Update existing values.

entry

view

View data from selected entries.

entry

write

Write data from selected entries.

extract

-

Extract calculation information from folders.

laspinit

-

Create Initial/Transition/Final structures for LASP-CBD.

retrieve

-

Queries the database.

test

db

Test database integrity.

test

self

Quick test for tunnel and db integrity.

test

tunnel

Test sql tunnel.

Help

You may get more details of the options available by running the command with the --help option.

$ catplat --help
$ catplat sub-command-1 --help
$ catplat sub-command-1 --sub-command-1-required-options sub-command-2 --help

Documentation

catplat

catplat [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--stream-log
--log
--verbose
--version

analyze

Analyze properties of structure files.

catplat analyze [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
adsorbate

Analyze adsorbate structure.

Example:

catplat analyze adsorbate –name CO

catplat analyze adsorbate [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

bulk

Analyze bulk structure.

Example:

catplat analyze bulk –name Cu_bulk

catplat analyze bulk [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

complex

Analyze complex structure.

Gives the percentage of images in top, bridge, three-fold, and four-fold hollow sites.

Example:

catplat analyze complex -n POSCAR_Rh36_O2 –slab-elements Rh –adsorbate O2

catplat analyze complex [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-a, --adsorbate <adsorbate>

Required

-s, --slab-elements <slab_elements>

Required

-v, --verbose, --no-verbose
--num-processes <num_processes>
--solfilter, --no-solfilter

Removes solvent (H2O) molecules from images. Requires solvation package

miller

Analyze bulk structure to obtain facet-like miller indices.

Example:

catplat analyze miller –name Cu_bulk –facet 111 –max-index 3

catplat analyze miller [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

-f, --facet <facet>

Required Facet of the surface i.e. 111, 100, 211.

-i, --max-index <max_index>

Maximum index to trial.

sites

Analyze adsorption sites of a slab.

Example:

catplat analyze sites -n SLAB_POSCAR

catplat analyze sites [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

--sites-in-cell, --no-sites-in-cell

Filter sites in cell.

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>

Filter connectivity.

-a, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>

Filter average coordination number.

-i, --sites <sites>

Filter site indices.

--unique, --no-unique

Filter unique site.

slab

Analyze slab structure.

Example:

catplat analyze slab -n Pt111

catplat analyze slab [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

build

Build/Write structures.

catplat build [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
adsorbate

Create/Write adsorbate structures.

Example:

# some adsorbates are available in the database catplat build adsorbate -n CO –box-size 10

# single atom adsorbates catplat build adsorbate -n atom:Cl –box-size 10

# generate adsorbate from smiles catplat build adsorbate -n “pubchem:CC(O)=O” –box-size 10

# generate adsorbate from pubchem id catplat build adsorbate -n pubchem:281 –box-size 10

# generate adsorbate from name catplat build adsorbate -n pubchem:Ethanol –box-size 10

catplat build adsorbate [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>

Required

--boxsize, --box-size <boxsize>
--write, --no-write

Write structures into folders

bulk

Create/Write bulk structures.

Example:

# get the stable fcc Cu bulk catplat build bulk –chemsys Cu –e-above-hull “<0.01” –spacegroup 225 –mpid mp-30

# get all the stable binary Cu-* bulks catplat build bulk –chemsys Cu-* –e-above-hull “<0.01” –spacegroup 225

catplat build bulk [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --chemsys <chemsys>

Species of the system, sorted alphabetically and separated by dashes. eg. –chemsys Cu-Rh

-e, --e-above-hull <e_above_hull>

Energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. Comparator strings are preferred over float unless exact match is desired.

-f, --bulk-formula <bulk_formula>

Bulk formula as indicated on Materials Project.

-s, --spacegroup <spacegroup>

Spacegroup number of bulk as indicated on Materials Project.

-i, --mpid <mpid>

Materials Project ID of bulk structure

--write, --no-write

Write structures into folders

complex

Create/Write complex structures.

Example:

# monodentate CH3 on top site, rotated 30 degrees catplat build complex -s Pt111 -a CH3 –bonds “[0]” –connectivity “[1]” –rotation 30

# bind adsorbate on site 40 catplat build complex -s Pt111 -a CH3 –sites “[40]”

# bidentate O2 on top-top site catplat build complex -s Pt111 -a O2 –bonds “[0,1]” –connectivity “[1,1]”

catplat build complex [OPTIONS]

Options

-a, --adsorbate-atoms, --adsorbate <adsorbate_atoms>

Required Name of adsorbate.Accepted inputs:(1) “path/to/X.xyz” (2) “X” if X.* in user/catplat adsorbate directory (3) “X” if X in ase.collections.g2 (4) “atom:X” (5) “pubchem:X”

-b, --bonds <bonds>

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. e.g. -b 0 -b 0,1 -b monodentate”

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>

Connectivity of adsorption site for adsorbate to bind. e.g. e.g. -c 1 -c 1,1

-n, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>

Average coordination of adsorption site for adsorbate to bind. e.g. -n 7 -n 7,7 -n “<=8”, -n “<8,7”

-i, --sites <sites>

Site indexes to be selected. e.g. e.g. -i 40 -i 40,41

--write, --no-write

Write structures into folders

--rotation <rotation>

Rotation of adsorbate.

-s, --slab <slab>

Name of slab file in user slab directory.

--unique, --no-unique

Whether or not to get unique sites only.

--write-schematic, --no-write-schematic

Write schematics

--random

Select a random adsorption site

multicomplex

Create/Write multi-adsorbate complex structures.

Example:

# coadsorb 2 x CO on Cu(100) slab. Only considering top and bridge sites, always include site 40, catplat build multicomplex -s Pt111 -a CO -q 2 –bonds 0 –connectivity 1,2 –sites 40

catplat build multicomplex [OPTIONS]

Options

-a, --adsorbate-atoms, --adsorbate <adsorbate_atoms>

Required Name of adsorbate.Accepted inputs:(1) “path/to/X.xyz” (2) “X” if X.* in user/catplat adsorbate directory (3) “X” if X in ase.collections.g2 (4) “atom:X” (5) “pubchem:X”

-b, --bonds <bonds>

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. e.g. -b 0 -b 0,1 -b monodentate”

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>

Connectivity of adsorption site for adsorbate to bind. e.g. e.g. -c 1 -c 1,1

-n, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>

Average coordination of adsorption site for adsorbate to bind. e.g. -n 7 -n 7,7 -n “<=8”, -n “<8,7”

-i, --sites <sites>

Site indexes to be selected. e.g. e.g. -i 40 -i 40,41

--write, --no-write

Write structures into folders

-s, --slab-atoms, --slab <slab_atoms>

Required Name of slab file in user slab directory. When slab is specified, other bulk and slab attributes should not be specified.

-q, --quantity <quantity>

Required Number of adsorbates to adsorb on the slab.

--dist-tol <dist_tol>

Filter structures that have adsorbates in close proximity, defaults to 0.8*{top-top distance}.

--write-schematic, --no-write-schematic

Write schematics

slab

Create/Write slab structures.

Example:

# Cu(100) slab with 5 layers, 3 fixed layers, 15A vacuum, 4x4 unit cell and a Rh overlayer catplat build slab -n Cu_bulk –overlayer Rh –miller-index 1 0 0 –num-layers 5 –num-fixed-layers 3 –vacuum 15 –unitcell-size 4 4

# Cu(211) slab catplat build slab -n Cu_bulk –miller-index 2 1 1 –num-layers 12 –num-fixed-layers 6 –unitcell-size 1 3

# Specify slab size by minimum dimensions catplat build slab -n Cu_bulk –miller-index 1 0 0 –length 10 10 –thickness 10

catplat build slab [OPTIONS]

Options

-o, --overlayer <overlayer>

Replaces top layer atoms with overlayer atoms.

-m, --miller-index, --miller <miller_index>

Required Miller idx of slab. eg. –miller-index 1 1 1

-s, --unitcell-size <unitcell_size>

Size of slab to be created.

-l, --num-layers <num_layers>

Number of layers of the slab.

-f, --num-fixed-layers <num_fixed_layers>

Number of layers to be fixed.

-v, --vacuum <vacuum>

Amount of vacuum (in angstroms) to add on “each side” of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vauum x 2) Vacuum should be an int.

--conventional <conventional>

Toggle for creation of conventional slabs.

--length <length>

Length (Å) of the slab.

--thickness <thickness>

Thickness (Å) of the slab.

--write, --no-write

Write structures into folders

-n, --name <name>

Required Path to bulk file or name of bulk file in user bulk directory

--rotate <rotate>

Rotate the slabs around the z-axis by the specified amount.

--sort-z, --no-sort-z

Sort slabs by their z-axis positions

--view, --no-view

View slabs via GUI.

calculate

Run Catplat workflow calculations.

Obtains results of specified system by first searching the database. If the results do not exist, calculate using DFT.

Examples:
catplat calculate –project <myproject> –chemsys Cu
catplat calculate [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --project <project>

Required Name of project to run. Contains information such as database_path, incar settings, etc.

--bulk-atoms <bulk_atoms>

Name of bulk file in user bulk directory. When bulk is specified, other bulk attributes such as e_above_hull should not be specified.

--chemsys <chemsys>

Chemical species of the bulk. Multiple elements should be separated by dashes. e.g. –chemsys Cu-Rh

--min-e-above-hull <min_e_above_hull>

Minimum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--max-e-above-hull <max_e_above_hull>

Maximum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--bulk-formula <bulk_formula>

Bulk formula as indicated on Materials Project. e.g. –bulk-formula Cu3Rh

--spacegroup <spacegroup>

Spacegroup number of bulk as indicated on Materials Project.

--mpid <mpid>

Materials Project ID of bulk structure

-s, --slab-atoms <slab_atoms>

Name of slab file in user slab directory. When slab is specified, other bulk and slab attributes should not be specified.

--termination <termination>

Slab termination, defined as the composition of the surface layer..

-o, --overlayer <overlayer>

If specified, replaces top layer atoms with overlayer atoms.

-m, --miller-index, --miller <miller_index>

Miller idx of slab. eg. –miller-index 1 1 1

--unitcell-size <unitcell_size>

Size of slab to be created in terms of number of unit cell repeats.

-l, --num-layers <num_layers>

Number of layers of the slab.

-f, --num-fixed-layers <num_fixed_layers>

Number of layers to be fixed.

-v, --min-vacuum <min_vacuum>

Minimum vacuum to add on each side of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vacuum x 2). [Å]

--conventional <conventional>

Toggle for creation of conventional slabs.

--min-length <min_length>

Minimum length of the slab x and y vectors respectively. [Å]

--min-thickness <min_thickness>

Minimum thickness of the slab. [Å]

--min-fixed-thickness <min_fixed_thickness>

Minimum fixed layers thickness of the slab. [Å]

-a, --adsorbate-atoms <adsorbate_atoms>

Name of adsorbate.Accepted inputs:(1) “path/to/X.xyz” (2) “X” if X.* in user/catplat adsorbate directory (3) “X” if X in ase.collections.g2 (4) “atom:X” (5) “pubchem:X” if X is a pubchem id or name

-b, --bonds <bonds>

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. “Monodentate”/”bidentate” can be specified for CatPlat to automatically determine the binding atoms.e.g. -b 0 -b 0,1 -b monodentate”

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>

Connectivity is the number of surface atoms of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. For a fcc(111) surface, for example, “1” is the top site, “2” is the bridge site. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -c 1 -c 1,1

-n, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>

Average coordination number of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. Can be an integer e.g. 7, or comparator e.g. <7. Single values for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated values for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -n 7 -n 7,7 -n “<=8”, -n “<8,7”

-r, --rotation <rotation>

Rotation of adsorbate around the axis of adsorption. For monodentate adsorbates only.

--ml-preoptimization, --ml-preopt

Flag to run preoptimization with MLPotential. Will default to True if –ml-potential-hash is specified.

--ml-potential-hash <ml_potential_hash>

Hash of the MLPotential to be used for preoptimization.

--skip-materials-project

Flag to skip querying Materials Project.

-n, --num-nodes <num_nodes>

Number of nodes to assign for each num-job-run-slots.

-N, --num-job-run-slots <num_job_run_slots>

Number of jobs to run in parallel.

--test

Flag for testing. Results will not be written to the database.

--server <server>

Name of server to run the job on. Will try to determine this automatically if unspecified.

--fakerunner

Flag to use FakeVaspOverallJobRunner(). Results will be written to the database with placeholder energy value of 123.0 eV.

--write-db, --no-write-db

If true, writes calculations of current session to {session_id}.db

config

Set up new project/view current project settings.

catplat config [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--user-settings-dir <user_settings_dir>

For advanced use only.

project

Configures the project name and associated path where the calculations and database for the project will reside.

catplat config project [OPTIONS]

Options

--name <name>

Required Set project name

--calculation-path, --calc-path <calculation_path>

Required Set calculation path for project.

--database-path, --db-path <database_path>

Required Set database path for project.

--initial-magmom-threshold <initial_magmom_threshold>

Sets the threshold below which, the bulk initial magmoms retrieved from the MaterialsProjectwill be removed to avoid triggering spin-polarized calculations.

show

Displays the METADATA file in user_project_settings.

catplat config show [OPTIONS]
user

Sets the main user catplat settings.

catplat config user [OPTIONS]

Options

--run-dir <run_dir>

Set catplat run directory.

--mysql-user <mysql_user>

Set SQL user.

--mysql-pwd <mysql_pwd>

Set sql password.

--mysql-host <mysql_host>

Set sql host.

database

Perform operations involving the whole database.

Can either specify a project name or a database file.

catplat database [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

-p, --project <project>

Name of project containing the database_path.

-f, --file <file>

Name of database file.

backup

Backup database to file.

Examples:
# Backup database to file
catplat database -p project backup –dst backup.db
catplat database backup [OPTIONS]

Options

--dst, --destination <dst>

Required

--append
--overwrite
upgrade

Upgrade database to a new version.

Examples:
# Upgrade database to latest version
catplat database -p project upgrade –dst upgraded.db

# Upgrade database to a specific version catplat database -p project upgrade –dst upgraded.db –version 23.10.5

catplat database upgrade [OPTIONS]

Options

--dst, --destination <dst>

Required

--version <version>

Version to upgrade to. If not specified, upgrade to latest version.

download

Download external resources for catplat.

catplat download [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
resources

Download ML potentials for catplat to user directory.

catplat download resources [OPTIONS]

dryrun

Quickly view structures created by catplat for the corresponding QuerySet.

Examples:
catplat dryrun –chemsys Cu
catplat dryrun [OPTIONS]

Options

--cleanup, --no-cleanup

Whether to clean up the project directory after calculation.

--bulk-atoms <bulk_atoms>

Name of bulk file in user bulk directory. When bulk is specified, other bulk attributes such as e_above_hull should not be specified.

--chemsys <chemsys>

Chemical species of the bulk. Multiple elements should be separated by dashes. e.g. –chemsys Cu-Rh

--min-e-above-hull <min_e_above_hull>

Minimum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--max-e-above-hull <max_e_above_hull>

Maximum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--bulk-formula <bulk_formula>

Bulk formula as indicated on Materials Project. e.g. –bulk-formula Cu3Rh

--spacegroup <spacegroup>

Spacegroup number of bulk as indicated on Materials Project.

--mpid <mpid>

Materials Project ID of bulk structure

-s, --slab-atoms <slab_atoms>

Name of slab file in user slab directory. When slab is specified, other bulk and slab attributes should not be specified.

--termination <termination>

Slab termination, defined as the composition of the surface layer..

-o, --overlayer <overlayer>

If specified, replaces top layer atoms with overlayer atoms.

-m, --miller-index, --miller <miller_index>

Miller idx of slab. eg. –miller-index 1 1 1

--unitcell-size <unitcell_size>

Size of slab to be created in terms of number of unit cell repeats.

-l, --num-layers <num_layers>

Number of layers of the slab.

-f, --num-fixed-layers <num_fixed_layers>

Number of layers to be fixed.

-v, --min-vacuum <min_vacuum>

Minimum vacuum to add on each side of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vacuum x 2). [Å]

--conventional <conventional>

Toggle for creation of conventional slabs.

--min-length <min_length>

Minimum length of the slab x and y vectors respectively. [Å]

--min-thickness <min_thickness>

Minimum thickness of the slab. [Å]

--min-fixed-thickness <min_fixed_thickness>

Minimum fixed layers thickness of the slab. [Å]

-a, --adsorbate-atoms <adsorbate_atoms>

Name of adsorbate.Accepted inputs:(1) “path/to/X.xyz” (2) “X” if X.* in user/catplat adsorbate directory (3) “X” if X in ase.collections.g2 (4) “atom:X” (5) “pubchem:X” if X is a pubchem id or name

-b, --bonds <bonds>

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. “Monodentate”/”bidentate” can be specified for CatPlat to automatically determine the binding atoms.e.g. -b 0 -b 0,1 -b monodentate”

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>

Connectivity is the number of surface atoms of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. For a fcc(111) surface, for example, “1” is the top site, “2” is the bridge site. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -c 1 -c 1,1

-n, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>

Average coordination number of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. Can be an integer e.g. 7, or comparator e.g. <7. Single values for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated values for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -n 7 -n 7,7 -n “<=8”, -n “<8,7”

-r, --rotation <rotation>

Rotation of adsorbate around the axis of adsorption. For monodentate adsorbates only.

--ml-preoptimization, --ml-preopt

Flag to run preoptimization with MLPotential. Will default to True if –ml-potential-hash is specified.

--ml-potential-hash <ml_potential_hash>

Hash of the MLPotential to be used for preoptimization.

--skip-materials-project

Flag to skip querying Materials Project.

entry

Perform operations on database entries. ie view attributes, set ignore flag etc.

catplat entry [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

-p, --project <project>

Required Name of project containing the database_path.

--id <id>

Required Database id to be edited.

delete

Delete selected entries.

Examples:
# delete id1 and id2
catplat entry -p project –id 1 –id 2 delete
catplat entry delete [OPTIONS]
delete-key

Delete attribute keys.

Examples:
# remove version and ignored attributes from id 1
catplat entry -p project –id 1 delete-key –key version –key ignored
catplat entry delete-key [OPTIONS]

Options

--key <key>

Required Attribute keys to be deleted

ignore

Ignore selected entries.

Examples:
# ignore id1 and id2:
catplat entry -p project –id 1 –id 2 ignore

# undo ignore for id1 and id2: catplat entry -p project –id 1 –id 2 ignore –no-ignore

catplat entry ignore [OPTIONS]

Options

--ignore, --no-ignore

Flag to set ignored to True or False.

update-key

Update existing values.

Examples:
# update the value of ignored to True
catplat entry -p project –id 1 update-key –key ignored –value True –typing bool

# insert new attribute kvps catplat entry -p project –id 1 update-key –key keyname –value 100 –typing float

catplat entry update-key [OPTIONS]

Options

--key <key>

Required Attribute key to be updated.

--value <value>

Required Value to be updated to.

--typing <typing>

Data type of the value. Typing should be str, int, float or bool.

view

View data from selected entries.

Examples:
# prints details of id1, id2 and id3 and visualizes their structures
catplat entry -p project –id 1 –id 2 –id 3 view –struct
catplat entry view [OPTIONS]

Options

--struct, --no-struct

Toggle to visualize the structure.

--traj, --no-traj

Toggle to visualize the relaxation trajectory in animation.

write

Write data from selected entries.

Examples:
# writes structures, full trajectories and the VASP files for id1, id2 and id3
catplat entry -p project –id 1 –id 2 –id 3 write –struct –full-traj –files
catplat entry write [OPTIONS]

Options

--csv, --no-csv

Toggle to write the results in csv format.

--csv-filename <csv_filename>

name of the csv file to be written, can include a full path.

--id-path <id_path>

the path corrspoding to the id(s) mentioned before where all relevant files will be written

--struct, --no-struct

Toggle to write the structure in POSCAR format.

--full-traj, --no-full-traj

Toggle to write the full trajectyory in ASE traj format.

--traj-gif, --no-traj-gif

Toggle to write an animated GIF file for the full trajectory.

--files, --no-files

Toggle to write the INCAR, KPOINTS, POTCAR and outputs.json files.

extract

Extract calculation information from folders.

Either update the corresponding relaxed entries in the database or store them anew. | Examples: | catplat extract -p projectname -f ‘/path/to/job1’ -f ‘/path/to/job2’ –id unrelaxedid1 –id unrelaxedid2 –parallel –np 2 | catplat extract -p projectname -f ‘/path/to/lot_of_jobs/id*’ –overwrite –np -1

catplat extract [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --project <project>

Required Name of project containing the database_path.

-f, --folder <folder>

Required the path of the folder(s) from which to extract the caulation data from, must be provided under quotes, e.g. -f “some/path”

--id <id>

Database id of the unrelaxed entry whose corresponding relaxed entry is to be edited.

--overwrite, --no-overwrite

Toggle to overwrite the existing data section, if one is found

--np <np>

Number of parallel threads. Use np=-1 to utilize the maximum number of available threads

--suppress-errors, --no-supress-errors

Toggle to silently skip the undesired, normally error-raising cases

--backend <backend>

the parallelization backend. options are “joblib” and “multiprocessing”

--chunksize <chunksize>

the chunksize option of multiprocessing.Pool.starmap

laspinit

Create Initial/Transition/Final structures for LASP-CBD.

catplat laspinit [OPTIONS]

Options

-f, --file <file>

Required Path to initial structure.

-i, --diss-idx <diss_idx>

Required List indicating containing atom index of bond breaking. eg. -i 77 73

-s, --slab-elements <slab_elements>

The element(s) of the slab. eg. -s Rh -s Pd

-c1, --ads1-connectivity <ads1_connectivity>

Connectivity for adsorbate 1.

-c2, --ads2-connectivity <ads2_connectivity>

Connectivity for adsorbate 2.

-a1, --ads1-acn <ads1_acn>

avg_coord_num for adsorbate 1.

-a2, --ads2-acn <ads2_acn>

avg_coord_num for adsorbate 2

--ads1-bind, --no-ads1-bind

Toggle to bind adsorbate 1 to the slab. (default=True)

--ads2-bind, --no-ads2-bind

Toggle to bind adsorbate 2 to the slab. (default=True)

--ads1-dir-filter, --no-ads1-dir-filter

Toggle to filter sites for adsorbate 1 that are in the same direction as the dissociation vector. (default=True)

--ads2-dir-filter, --no-ads2-dir-filter

Toggle to filter sites for adsorbate 2 that are in the same direction as the dissociation vector. (default=False)

--ads1-dist-filter, --no-ads1-dist-filter

Toggle to filter sites for adsorbate 1 that are too close. (default=True)

--ads2-dist-filter, --no-ads2-dist-filter

Toggle to filter sites for adsorbate 2 that are too close. (default=False)

-x1, --ads1-dist-tol <ads1_dist_tol>

Tolerance parameter for ads1_dist_filter (default=1.5) Syntax: -x1 1.5

-x2, --ads2-dist-tol <ads2_dist_tol>

Tolerance parameter for ads2_dist_filter (default=1.5) Syntax: -x2 1.5

-y1, --ads1-dir-tol <ads1_dir_tol>

Tolerance parameter for ads1_dir_tol (default=0.5) Syntax: -y1 0.5

-y2, --ads2-dir-tol <ads2_dir_tol>

Tolerance parameter for ads2_dir_tol (default=0.5) Syntax: -y2 0.5

-t, --ts-tol <ts_tol>

Distance to increase bond length by for the transition state. (default=0.5) Syntax: -t 0.5

--zoom, --no-zoom

Toggle to select IS and FS that is closer to the TS. (default=True)

-z, --zoom-tol <zoom_tol>

Distance to of bond length dbetween IS-TS-FS. (default=0.3) Syntax: -z 0.3

mlp

Commands related to ML potentials.

catplat mlp [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
view

View all MLPs available to catplat.

catplat mlp view [OPTIONS]

projects

View current projects.

catplat projects [OPTIONS]

retrieve

Queries the database.

Obtains results of specified system by searching the database only.

Examples:
catplat retrieve –project <myproject> –chemsys Cu
catplat retrieve [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --project <project>

Required Name of project to run. Contains information such as database_path, incar settings, etc.

--bulk-atoms <bulk_atoms>

Name of bulk file in user bulk directory. When bulk is specified, other bulk attributes such as e_above_hull should not be specified.

--chemsys <chemsys>

Chemical species of the bulk. Multiple elements should be separated by dashes. e.g. –chemsys Cu-Rh

--min-e-above-hull <min_e_above_hull>

Minimum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--max-e-above-hull <max_e_above_hull>

Maximum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--bulk-formula <bulk_formula>

Bulk formula as indicated on Materials Project. e.g. –bulk-formula Cu3Rh

--spacegroup <spacegroup>

Spacegroup number of bulk as indicated on Materials Project.

--mpid <mpid>

Materials Project ID of bulk structure

--bulk-provenance <bulk_provenance>

String for the origin of bulk atoms.

-s, --slab-atoms <slab_atoms>

Name of slab file in user slab directory. When slab is specified, other bulk and slab attributes should not be specified.

--termination <termination>

Slab termination, defined as the composition of the surface layer..

-o, --overlayer <overlayer>

If specified, replaces top layer atoms with overlayer atoms.

-m, --miller-index, --miller <miller_index>

Miller idx of slab. eg. –miller-index 1 1 1

--unitcell-size <unitcell_size>

Size of slab to be created in terms of number of unit cell repeats.

-l, --num-layers <num_layers>

Number of layers of the slab.

-f, --num-fixed-layers <num_fixed_layers>

Number of layers to be fixed.

-v, --min-vacuum <min_vacuum>

Minimum vacuum to add on each side of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vacuum x 2). [Å]

--conventional <conventional>

Toggle for creation of conventional slabs.

--min-length <min_length>

Minimum length of the slab x and y vectors respectively. [Å]

--min-thickness <min_thickness>

Minimum thickness of the slab. [Å]

--min-fixed-thickness <min_fixed_thickness>

Minimum fixed layers thickness of the slab. [Å]

--slab-provenance <slab_provenance>

String for the origin of slab atoms.

--max-vacuum <max_vacuum>

Maxmimum vacuum (in Angstroms) to add on each side of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vauum x 2).

--max-length <max_length>

Maxmimum length(Å) of the slab x and y vectors respectively.

--max-thickness <max_thickness>

Maxmimum thickness(Å) of the slab.

--max-fixed-thickness <max_fixed_thickness>

Maxmimum fixed layers thickness(Å) of the slab.

--slab-chemsys <slab_chemsys>

Species of the slab, sorted alphabetically and separated by dashes.

--slab-formula <slab_formula>

Formula of the slab.

--min-slab-acn <min_slab_acn>

Minimum Average Coordination Number of the slab surface atoms.

--max-slab-acn <max_slab_acn>

Maximum Average Coordination Number of the slab surface atoms.

-a, --adsorbate-atoms <adsorbate_atoms>

Name of adsorbate.Accepted inputs:(1) “path/to/X.xyz” (2) “X” if X.* in user/catplat adsorbate directory (3) “X” if X in ase.collections.g2 (4) “atom:X” (5) “pubchem:X” if X is a pubchem id or name

-b, --bonds <bonds>

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. “Monodentate”/”bidentate” can be specified for CatPlat to automatically determine the binding atoms.e.g. -b 0 -b 0,1 -b monodentate”

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>

Connectivity is the number of surface atoms of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. For a fcc(111) surface, for example, “1” is the top site, “2” is the bridge site. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -c 1 -c 1,1

-n, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>

Average coordination number of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. Can be an integer e.g. 7, or comparator e.g. <7. Single values for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated values for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -n 7 -n 7,7 -n “<=8”, -n “<8,7”

-r, --rotation <rotation>

Rotation of adsorbate around the axis of adsorption. For monodentate adsorbates only.

--adsorbate-formula <adsorbate_formula>

Formula of adsorbate.

--id <id>

Database id of query.

--workflow-type <workflow_type>

Workflow type of query. Three workflow types, namely, “bulk”, “slab” and “adsorbate”.

--relaxed <relaxed>

Boolean specifying if structures to be queried are relaxed or not.

--unrelaxed_id <unrelaxed_id>

Unrelaxed database id of query.

--parent_id <parent_id>

Parent id of query.

--ml-preoptimization, --ml-preopt, --no-ml-preoptimization, --no-ml-preopt
--write-csv, --no-write-csv

Toggle to write the retrieved results in csv format.

--csv-filename <csv_filename>

name of the csv file to be written, can include a full path.

statistics

catplat statistics [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

-p, --project <project>

Required Name of project containing the database_path.

entries
catplat statistics entries [OPTIONS]

test

Test catplat.

catplat test [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
db

Test database integrity. 1) Use –database-path if you want to test an existing database. 2) Use –test-case-1 for quick testing of a new catplat_version. 3) Use –test-case-1 and –calculate for comprehensive testing of a new catplat_version.

Examples:
catplat test db –database-path ~/path/to/database.db
catplat test db –test-case-1
catplat test db –test-case-1 –calculate –server asp2acpu -n 2 -N 2
–project <myproject> –chemsys Cu
catplat test db [OPTIONS]

Options

--test-case-1

Flag to run “test-case-1”, tests the db output.

--calculate

Flag to define if real calculations should be done for “test-case-1”

--database-path, --db-path <database_path>

Path to database to be checked.

--server <server>

Name of server to run the job on. Will try to determine this automatically if unspecified.

-n, --num-nodes <num_nodes>

Number of nodes to assign for each num-job-run-slots.

-N, --num-job-run-slots <num_job_run_slots>

Number of jobs to run in parallel.

self

Quick test for tunnel and db integrity.

catplat test self [OPTIONS]
tunnel

Test sql tunnel.

catplat test tunnel [OPTIONS]

tunnel

Tunneling from compute nodes to the mysql server.

catplat tunnel [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
create

Create the tunnel.

catplat tunnel create [OPTIONS]

Options

--dst, --destination <dst>

Required

--debug
destroy

Destroy all tunnels.

catplat tunnel destroy [OPTIONS]

welcome

Prints the welcome message.

catplat welcome [OPTIONS]
